content: Calculate the temperature difference between the coldest recorded temperature in Antarctica, which is -128.6°F, and the average temperature of the Sahara desert, which is 86°F.

To find the temperature difference between the coldest recorded temperature in Antarctica and the average temperature of the Sahara Desert, you simply subtract the colder temperature from the warmer temperature:

Temperature in the Sahara Desert: 86°F  
Coldest recorded temperature in Antarctica: -128.6°F

Temperature difference = 86°F - (-128.6°F)  
                           = 86°F + 128.6°F  
                           = 214.6°F

The temperature difference is 214.6°F.
